runs.comm: slow, flighted, turns away and beats the bat.
appeal for lbw as this one goes straight on, that was so close!!
pushed towards the leg side off the front foot
slow and loopy, the batsman comes forward to defend that
tossed up on the middle and leg, this one is full and is pushed to the right of mid-on
another flighted delivery on off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of length but this one is wide down the leg side
short and quick outside off, the batsman goes for the cut but is late on the shot. He chops it down and the ball bounces over the slip fielder
oh that one is a peach!! back of length delivery on off, the batsman stays back to defend that, but the ball just leaves the batsman and beats him in his defence
short and quick, the batsman tries to get under it and guide it over slips, but that was too quick. The bowler slips in his follow through though. No damage done
short of length on the middle, the batsman defends it to mid-on and calls for a quick single
he keeps it tight and quick. This one is again short and on the off stump, the batsman hops as he defends it down the pitch
short and gets up on the batsman, who somehow manages to keep it down
he keeps it tight with another short of length ball on the middle, defended off the back foot
shortish outside off, the batsman goes back and punches it to cover
this one goes for a boundary past a flying point fielder. It was short of length and Guptill plays it in the air towards point
short of length and this is beautifully punched off the back foot between the cover and the point fielder. Nothing more than a punch and it sped on the green
short of length outside off, Guptill steers it to third-man easily off the back foot
short ball outside off, the batsman sways out of line
Morkel's extra pace beats the batsman again. The ball was on length and the batsman just tried to drive it down the ground, but played inside the line
length ball again, tries to drive it over cover but doesn't get any timing
full and honing on the leg stump, blocked towards long-on
short of length on the off stump, defended to point from the crease
that's a golf swing! Guptill makes room and just lifts it over the bowler's head for a six. That came off the toe of the bat
a quick short ball comes as a response and Guptill ducks under it
takes a couple of steps and tries to pull that ball off a length, misses and the ball goes through to the keeper

short ball outside off and Nicol makes an attempt to pull it. The ball was wide and took the top-edge, Phangiso makes a flying attempt to get to that at short fine leg. That could have been the catch of the century no. 2
short of length on the off stump line, defended off the back foot
tries to play the short he attempted in the first ball, makes contact with the ball, but it's a bottom-edge this time. It rolls past the stumps
finally makes contact with this short ball as he lifts it over mid-on/midwicket for a one-bounce four
short and a bit wide outside off, the batsman tries his favourite pull again. It goes through the same region for another boundary
length ball outside leg, gives away an extra
short ball, it is surprisingly quick for the batsman who gets into a tangle as he tries to get under it
another one down the leg side, it hits the thigh-pad on the way
length ball on off, defended without feet movement towards cover
attempts a yorker, but it's a low full-toss. The batsman doesn't get much timing as he hits it towards mid-on
nicely timed!! The batsman just punches it from the crease past the left of mid-on. The ball-kid comes inside the boundary to field that as Morkel had given up the chase
short of length on off, played with soft hands towards the off and the batsmen take a quick single
tossed up and doesn't spin, the batsman goes back to cut and gets an edge very late. That was almost a wicket ball
slow and tossed up, the batsman takes a couple of steps down and defends
the batsman comes down again, but can only hit it back to the bowler
slightly short, the batsman goes back and cuts it straight to point
short again, it's punched to deep cover off the back foot
short and outside off, the batsman gets beaten by the bounce as he attempts to cut.
short of length on the pads, the batsman goes for the pull and misses, the ball still hits the pads and rolls to the boundary at fine-leg
short of length on off and middle, the batsman stays back and turns it to deep square leg
on the pads again and this one is going to run to the boundary again
short of length outside off, the batsman stays back and drops it toward third man off the back foot
fuller delivery outside off, the batsman squeezes that too deep cover
length ball on off, the batsman goes back and across and pushes it to long-on
tossed up and this time Guptill gets under it and sends a monster hit to the stands behind the sight screen
flighted again, pushed back to the bowler
quicker on the pads, the batsman gets a leading edge towards off as he tries to turn it away on leg
shortish length on off, punched to deep cover off the back foot
takes a step down, the ball is short but he adjusts to cut it hard to deep point
slow and flighted on the middle, the batsman plays it with soft hands towards the right of the bowler, takes off for a quick single
slow and flat on the middle, comes in with the arm, the ball takes an inside edge as he tries to push it to mid-on
now he wait for this shortish delivery and pulls it very hard to square leg boundary
sweeps again and this one's a monster! it goes miles over the square leg boundary
very slow, the batsman has time to go right back and push it hard to long-on
caught at long-on! Nicol charges out to a tossed up delivery, but the ball was really slow and he doesn't get his timing right as he tries to scoop it over long-on. It goes straight to the fielder
goes right back to this slow delivery, punches it to lon-on
tossed up, but this is outside leg stump and Guptill sweeps it very hard to deep backward square leg boundary
slower and on the middle, the batsman plays it towards deep midwicket with soft hands, calls for two, but is unable to
tossed up and full, McCullum comes forward and drives it to long off
and another boundary with the sweep shot. He doesn't get the timing right in this one, but it's in the gap and that is a solid half-century for Guptill
tossed up on off, driven straight to cover
tossed up on leg stump, it was full and Guptill gets hit on the pads as he attempts a sweep. That was very close but the umpire doesn't show interest in that appeal. very close.
tossed up, it's a low full-toss, driven to long-on
flatter delivery and it goes down the leg side. The bowler appeals, but the umpire calls a wide
punched off the back foot towards cover where Faf makes a diving stop
tossed up on middle, driven hard to long-off
another full and flighted delivery on the middle, driven to long-on now
flighted on the middle, Guptill goes across and plays a fine sweep which beats the short fine leg fielder
and this one is tossed up almost waist high and that has been sent over midwicket.
fuller delivery outside off, McLaren makes a diving stop to his left at mid-off
fuller ball and Guptill goes for a big swing, it looked like  it was going out of the ground, but only went behind midwicket. Peterson runs backwards but can't quite do a Neesham
quick length ball outside off, the batsman goes for a cut but gets beaten for pace
short of length ball outside off, guided towards third-man
full ball on the pads, flicked to deep backward square for a single
moves across to this full delivery and misses. It just lands inches from the leg stump on its way to the keeper. The bowler has his hands on his head
flighted delivery and McCullum comes down charging, drives it past the non-striker for a single
on the pads, Guptill goes for a sweep but finds short fine leg
down the leg side again, Gutpill misses his sweep, Keeper misses the ball and it's five wides
flighted and slow on off, defended back to the bowler
and another monster sweep, this one goes miles into the air and when it comes down, it's in the crowd at deep midwicket
tossed up and Guptill misses his sweep, get hit on the back pad. It was very close again.
Home run! Guptill chooses the straight boundary this time, he takes a two steps down and clears the ground easily. It is over the sight screen and out of sight.
short of length outside off, punched hard to deep cover from the crease
short slower ball, the batsman waits and pulls it to the gap at deep backward square leg and the two run a couple
short ball, sails over the shoulder
full and on the middle, driven to mid-off
short of length ball, but McCullum has already charged down halfway, he still manages to pull it hard to deep square leg
full on off, Guptill toe-ends it to mid-on for a single
short and wide, it was there to be hit, but bounces a bit extra and Guptill gets beaten
slower ball on off, Guptill plays it awkwardly towards deep square leg
short of length on the middle, McCullum makes room to cut, straight to point
fuller ball outside off, the batsman tries to smash it from the crease, gets a healthy outside edge
slower bouncer and McCullum gets beaten on his pull as he plays it too early

short of length on off and quick-hands McCullum goes for a pull. His hands came so quick on that. The ball went high and Behardien completely misjudges that. He was there at the boundary, getting ready under it, but inexplicably lets it fall next to him and it goes to the boundary. He was worries about being too close to the boundary
full ball, driven hard to long-off
slow short ball, McCullum goes for the pull and misses, gets hit on the chest
full toss wide outside off, Guptill is the man today, he crashes it through point for a boundary

another full toss, it was a slower ball and it messes up with Guptill's timing, straight to the fielder at long-on. Umpires are checking the ball for the height. It's a no-ball. Guptill survives again
fuller length and McCullum drives it hard towards long-off, who fields it after one bounce
full and quick on off, the batsman blocks it towards the leg side and calls for a quick single
caught at long on! length ball on the middle, McCullum aims his shot at the sight screen, but that hits high on the bat and doesn't get the distance. It goes comfortably to the fielder at long on
short of length on off, punched to cover, who makes a good stop
manages a single as he pushes this down the ground for a single
dropped! Guptill rides his luck-buggy. He heaved this one and the leading edge carried the ball to the moon. It came down after ages and Peterson drops it at point
Guptill rubs it now, stays back to this short of length ball, and guides it from where the slips should be for a four
full toss on the middle, punched to midwicket
slower full toss, Munro mishits it, on to himself, but manages a single
length ball on the pads, Munro drives it to deep midwicket
fuller ball, crashed hard to long-on, they want one, they want two.. confusion reins
fuller ball, Munro drives it over the bowler's head and the batsman run for their lives and take a couple
fuller ball outside off, and another 100m Olympic medal winning sprint from the two as this was straight to long-on
short slower delivery outside off, the batsman chops it without any timing to point.

He has done it!! That wasn't the best timed shot, but that had enough on it to beat the fielder at cover and roll on to the boundary. Guptill shows all the emotion there, he is ecstatic! Only the second Kiwi batsman to get a hundred in T20, but more importantly, only the second batsman ever in T20 to get a hundred in a chase
